text: Mediocre service from the serving aunty even though I was the sole customer on an early weekday evening. Ordered horfun $5.50 which was served in 2 minutes. This suggests that the horfun was pre fried and simply reheated with the sauce upon ordering. Sauce was average, ingredients were passable but horfun was partially burnt and clumped together in parts. Chao tar, not wok hei. Do not recommend.
Pork, Har Chiong Kai, is exceptionally good.  Vegetables a bit old stock.

My 2nd visit after trying their neighbor Bak Kut Teh and steam fish few days ago. They both share the same space in this coffeeshop or restaurant. No aircon, just open air with fans. Great atmosphere especially during year end Christmas season, cooling and windy, hot sun is hardly exist.

Initially we wish to order curry fishhead, but owner insisted trying their tomyam flavor, and we are convinced.

Yes. It was really good flavour and fresh fish. The flavor was quite unique, unlike usual tomyam spicy and sour taste, their version are more like thin curry with tomyam spices, not too spicy, and with slight sour taste.

Fish head size was okay, but not really large, price slightly high, usually $27+ but they charged $30 for their selection. Most importantly, the taste and large amount of veggies was still worth it.

The sweet and sour pork, we liked it very much, meat was decent, is crispy with great sweet and sour flavors. Added another stir-fry vegetables, not a bad plate of green too, is enough for two of us with great simple flavor.

Sweet and sour pork priced and $12 and vegetable cost $8. Still a affordable food selection and pricing. Overall, we loved it. Conclusion, we will definitely come back. Recommended.

28March2025
Came 2nd time to try. This round the fun was so much better taste . We ordered other dishes . Not too bad. Only a bit expensive.

Hor fun wok hey yes but still can improve. The gravy is diluted and plain. I guess it is complacency or too tired. I wonder about the rest of the dishes. If Hor fun is not done right, how can I continue with the rest of the dishes?  I gave 3 stars as I yet to try the rest.üòâü§≠

Date of visit: Sun 17 Dec 2023
Time : 7 pm

Four of us. Seated easily, at a round table.
Ordered claypot fish head and our favorite yam ring.

The claypot fish head is small. Sauce is slightly on the sweet side unfortunately.

Date of visit: Sun 23 Jul 2023
Time : 8.30 pm

This time ordered the yam ring and stir fried Â•∂ÁôΩËèú vegetables.

The yam ring stuffings are very generous and packed with vegetables, mushrooms, prawns and chicken meat.

Really good food. A bit too much for 2 of us. The yam ring would suffice.

Cost us $29.60 with 2 rice.

Date of visit: Thurs 6 Jul 2023
Time 9 pm

This time ordered the assam fish head for 2 plus 2 rice.
Assam fish head just as good. Sour sweet and saltiness the right flavor.

Date of visit: Sun 11 Jun 2023
Time 8.30 pm

A small coffee shop with this zhi char stall and a bak kut teh stall beside.

Most tables seated.

Ordered just a curry fish head to try. Only 2 of us.

Flavors good, even slightly on the sourish side making the curry not too heavy going. The half fish head is small but fresh. Vegetables brinjal, lady fingers, cabbage all good and some dried tau pok soso.
